returns._0: The address of the deployment. May be `address(0)` if the deployment does not         exist.
Whether the deployment exists or not.

loadInitializedSlot(string).details: Returns the value of the internal `_initialized` storage slot for a given contract.

params._addr: The mock address of the deployment.

get(string).notice: Returns a deployment that is suitable to be used to interact with contracts.

getAbi(string).notice: Returns the abi from a the forge artifact

getAddress(string).notice: Returns the address of a deployment. Also handles the predeploys.

getMethodIdentifiers(string).notice: Returns the methodIdentifiers from the forge artifact

getStorageLayout(string).notice: Returns the storage layout for a deployed contract.

has(string).notice: Returns whether or not a particular deployment exists.

mustGetAddress(string).notice: Returns the address of a deployment and reverts if the deployment         does not exist.

name().notice: Returns the name of the deployment script. Children contracts         must implement this to ensure that the deploy artifacts can be found.         This should be the same as the name of the script and is used as the file         name inside of the `broadcast` directory when looking up deployment artifacts.

newDeployments().notice: Returns all of the deployments done in the current context.

save(string,address).notice: Appends a deployment to disk as a JSON deploy artifact.

setUp().notice: Create the global variables and set up the filesystem.         Forge script will create a file where the prefix is the         name of the function that runs with the suffix `-latest.json`.         By default, `run()` is called. Allow the user to use the SIG         env var to specify what function signature was called so that         the `sync()` method can be used to create hardhat deploy style         artifacts.

get(string).notice: Returns a deployment that is suitable to be used to interact with contracts.

getAbi(string).notice: Returns the abi from a the forge artifact

getAddress(string).notice: Returns the address of a deployment. Also handles the predeploys.

getMethodIdentifiers(string).notice: Returns the methodIdentifiers from the forge artifact

getStorageLayout(string).notice: Returns the storage layout for a deployed contract.

has(string).notice: Returns whether or not a particular deployment exists.

mustGetAddress(string).notice: Returns the address of a deployment and reverts if the deployment         does not exist.

name().notice: Returns the name of the deployment script. Children contracts         must implement this to ensure that the deploy artifacts can be found.         This should be the same as the name of the script and is used as the file         name inside of the `broadcast` directory when looking up deployment artifacts.

newDeployments().notice: Returns all of the deployments done in the current context.

save(string,address).notice: Appends a deployment to disk as a JSON deploy artifact.

setUp().notice: Create the global variables and set up the filesystem.         Forge script will create a file where the prefix is the         name of the function that runs with the suffix `-latest.json`.         By default, `run()` is called. Allow the user to use the SIG         env var to specify what function signature was called so that         the `sync()` method can be used to create hardhat deploy style         artifacts.

DeploymentDoesNotExist(string).notice: Error for when attempting to fetch a deployment and it does not exist

InvalidDeployment(string).notice: Error for when trying to save an invalid deployment

userdoc.notice: A contract that can make deploying and interacting with deployments easy.         When a contract is deployed, call the `save` function to write its name and         contract address to disk. Inspired by `forge-deploy`.

returns._0: The address of the deployment. May be `address(0)` if the deployment does not         exist.
Whether the deployment exists or not.

loadInitializedSlot(string).details: Returns the value of the internal `_initialized` storage slot for a given contract.

params._addr: The mock address of the deployment.

documentation.text:
@notice Contains information about a storage slot. Mirrors the layout of the storage
         slot object in Forge artifacts so that we can deserialize JSON into this struct.
@notice Path to the deploy artifact generated by foundry

@notice The name of the deploy script that sends the transactions.
         Can be modified with the env var DEPLOY_SCRIPT

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (string memory,string memory) view external returns (string memory)
function (string memory,string memory) view external returns (string memory)
function (string memory,string memory) view external returns (string memory)

documentation.text:
@notice Create the global variables and set up the filesystem.
         Forge script will create a file where the prefix is the
         name of the function that runs with the suffix `-latest.json`.
         By default, `run()` is called. Allow the user to use the SIG
         env var to specify what function signature was called so that
         the `sync()` method can be used to create hardhat deploy style
         artifacts.

@notice Returns the name of the deployment script. Children contracts
         must implement this to ensure that the deploy artifacts can be found.
         This should be the same as the name of the script and is used as the file
         name inside of the `broadcast` directory when looking up deployment artifacts.

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (string memory[] memory) external returns (bytes memory)

documentation.text:
@notice Removes the semantic versioning from a contract name. The semver will exist if the contract is compiled
 more than once with different versions of the compiler.

@notice Builds the fully qualified name of a contract. Assumes that the
         file name is the same as the contract name but strips semver for the file name.

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (string memory[] memory) external returns (bytes memory)

documentation.text: @notice Returns the storage layout for a deployed contract.

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (string memory[] memory) external returns (bytes memory)

documentation.text: @notice Returns the abi from a the forge artifact

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (string memory[] memory) external returns (bytes memory)
function (string memory,string memory) pure returns (string memory[] memory)

documentation.text: @notice Returns the methodIdentifiers from the forge artifact

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (string memory[] memory) external returns (bytes memory)
function (string memory[] memory) external returns (bytes memory)
function (string memory,string memory) pure returns (string memory[] memory)

documentation.text:
@notice Returns the filesystem path to the artifact path. If the contract was compiled
         with multiple solidity versions then return the first one based on the result of `ls`.

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (string memory) view external returns (string memory)

documentation.text: @notice Returns the forge artifact given a contract name.

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (string memory[] memory) external returns (bytes memory)
function (string memory) pure external returns (bytes memory)

documentation.text: @dev Pulls the `_initialized` storage slot information from the Forge artifacts for a given contract.
@dev Returns the value of the internal `_initialized` storage slot for a given contract.
